intro: Pyrethrum leucanthemifolium, commonly known as white leucanthemum, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces showy white to pale yellow flowers with a central disk surrounded by ray florets, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Pyrethrum leucanthemifolium is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has historical uses in herbal medicine.
